intro: Aneilema coreanum, commonly known as the Korean flame bamboo, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Phyllostachydaeae and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of bright red or orange bracts. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often overlooked in favor of its striking foliage. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a landscape plant. Aneilema coreanum prefers moist, well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
